member.name: T:Kusto.Ingest.FileWatchIngestorCommandLineArgs
member.summary: A configuration object that can accept arguments from the command line to determine the behavior of .
member.remarks:
Configuration must be explicitly enabled by setting to true. Without this, the configuration is void.
The flag can be used when developing this class. It should not be used in any other scenario.
The property indicates the local filesystem path to watch. It defaults to "RollingLogs", relative to the process current directory.
The properties and provide details on a pre-existing Kusto database and table that will hold the uploaded data. The database name is not mandatory if pushing traces through streaming ingestion (as the connection string can provide it). The table name defaults to "KustoLogs".
If specified, the property indicates that traces are pushed by using streaming ingestion. The value of this property is a connection string to the Kusto engine cluster and database. For example: "https://MYCLUSTER.ITSREGION.kusto.windows.net/DATABASENAME;Fed=true".
Otherwise, traces are pushed by uploading them to Azure Blob Storage and sending messages to Azure Queue (Kusto Native Ingestion). One can specify the Azure Storage details directly (, ) or by providing the class with the DM's connection string (and then the DM will provide these details dynamically). You can also encrypt the Azure Storage secrets, and specify the key to decrypt them using "ArgumentsDecryptionCertificateThumbprint" in command line arguments. />.
Lastly, set when using the DM's connection string to have new Azure Blob Containers created per day of ingestion.
member.example:
The following example enables trace pushing through the streaming endpoint:
-enableTracePush -quickLogs:https://MYCLUSTER.ITSREGION.kusto.windows.net/DATABASENAME;Fed=true

member.name: T:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo
member.summary: This class represents a command to the Data Management's Aggregator to ingest a single blob of data (native ingestion). The command is serialized/deserialized into an Azure Queue message using methods, and is the contract between clients and the Data Management service.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.BlobPath
member.summary: The URI of the blob, potentially including the secret needed to access the blob. Mandatory.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.RawDataSize
member.summary: An estimation of the raw (uncompressed, un-indexed) size of the data. Optional.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.DatabaseName
member.summary: The name of the database holding the target table. Mandatory.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.TableName
member.summary: The name of the target table into which the data will be ingested. Mandatory.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.AdditionalProperties
member.summary: Additional properties that affect ingestion. Optional.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.Id
member.summary: A unique identifier for this ingestion command. Optional.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.RetainBlobOnSuccess
member.summary: Whether to retain the blob or delete it on successful ingestion. Defaults to false. Optional.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.ReportLevel
member.summary: Required ingestion reporting level. Defaults to FailuresOnly.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.ReportMethod
member.summary: Controls the target of the ingestion status reporting. Available options are Azure Queue, Azure Table, or both. Defaults to 'Queue'.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.IngestionStatusInTable
member.summary: The pointer of the ingestions status table row, potentially including the secret needed to access the table.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.SourceMessageCreationTime
member.summary: The source message creation time (when the source message was inserted to the first input queue (that is, obtainer queue), will be used to measure the total latency)

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.FlushImmediately
member.summary: Whether to immediately try to ingest the blob on receipt. Default to false (the system will attempt to batch the blob with similar blobs targeted at the same table). It is strongly recommended that this is kept disabled unless there's a specific scenario that requires it. Optional.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionBlobInfo.IgnoreSizeLimit
member.summary: Determines whether the default size limit per single ingestion source should be ignored. Defaults to false. The implications are that blob sizes will be verified and all sources that exceed the maximal size of 4 GB will not be ingested. Optional.

member.name: T:Kusto.Ingest.SplitSourceTableReportKustoIngestionResult
member.summary: Allows tracking the ingestion status when the source supplied is too large and needs to be split into multiple sources to be ingested. This class saves the original source ID, as well as the source ID of all sources created from it. The original source ID is used to track the status of all ingestions.

member.remarks: Any change to this class must be made in a backwards/forwards-compatible manner.

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.Status
member.summary: The ingestion status returned from the service. Status remains 'Pending' during the ingestion process and is updated by the service once the ingestion completes. When is set to 'Queue', the ingestion status will always be 'Queued' and the caller needs to query the reports queues for ingestion status, as configured. To query statuses that were reported to queue, see: . When is set to 'Table', call or to retrieve the most recent ingestion status.

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.IngestionSourceId
member.summary: A unique identifier representing the ingested source. It can be supplied during the ingestion execution.

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.IngestionSourcePath
member.summary: The URI of the blob, potentially including the secret needed to access the blob. This can be a filesystem URI (on-premises deployments only), or an Azure Blob Storage URI (including a SAS key or a semicolon followed by the account key)

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.Database

member.summary: The name of the target table into which the data will be ingested.

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.UpdatedOn

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.OperationId
member.summary: The ingestion's operation ID.

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.ActivityId

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.ErrorCode
member.summary: In case of a failure, indicates the failure's error code.

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.FailureStatus
member.summary: In case of a failure, indicates the failure's status.

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.Details

member.name: P:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionStatus.OriginatesFromUpdatePolicy

member.name: T:Kusto.Ingest.Status
member.summary: An enum representing the state of a data ingestion operation into Kusto.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.Status.Pending
member.summary: Represents a temporary status. Might change during the course of ingestion based on the outcome of the data ingestion operation into Kusto.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.Status.Succeeded
member.summary: Represents a permanent status. The data has been successfully ingested to Kusto.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.Status.Failed
member.summary: Represents a permanent status. The data has not been ingested to Kusto.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.Status.Queued
member.summary: Represents a permanent status. The data has been queued for ingestion. (This does not indicate that the ingestion was successful.)

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.Status.Skipped
member.summary: Represents a permanent status. No data was supplied for ingestion. The ingest operation was skipped.

member.name: F:Kusto.Ingest.Status.PartiallySucceeded
member.summary: Represents a permanent status. Part of the data was successfully ingested to Kusto, while other parts failed.

member.name: T:Kusto.Ingest.IngestionSuccessInfo
member.summary: The serialization format for messages of ingestion successes. You shouldn't make changes to this class without first understanding the backwards compatibility implications.

member.name: T:Kusto.Ingest.KustoManagedStreamingIngestClient
member.summary:
KustoManagedStreamingIngestClient implements IKustoIngestClient and it provides a managed way to perform streaming ingestion. This is a hybrid client which uses the KustoStreamingIngestClient to perform streaming ingest and KustoQueuedIngestClient as a fallback in certain scenarios. First the client tries to ingest using streaming ingest and in case of a transient error it handles retry operation with exponential back off, while the client is waiting it aggregates calls with the same ingestion properties in a StreamCollection to reduce the load on the server.
The client will use queued ingestion as a fallback in the following cases: 1. The source size is above streaming ingest size limit. 2. Number of retries after transient errors exceeds the defined limit. 3. Number of streaming ingest concurrent calls exceeds the client's limit.
